content: and do two more chains then pull on the back loop to tighten this chain round 2 single_crochet one into each of the doubled-up chains 4 chain then tighten round 3 do both a half_double_crochet and a single_crochet into the last single_crochet you just did into the doubled-up chain below that single_crochet do a half_double_crochet and a single_crochet in each of the next two doubled chains do one single_crochet in the last doubled up chain do a corner series in the single_crochet attached to that doubled chain do a half_double_crochet and a single_crochet then do 3 regular scs to complete the round 14 to join this round do the slip stitch and chain up in purple head and body continued round 4 do one single_crochet in purple making sure the final loop you pull through to finish your single_crochet is a pink loop continuing in pink do a corner series 4 single_crochet and a corner series invisible color change to purple and do 1 single_crochet invisible color change to pink and do a corner series 4 single_crochet and a corner series 22 do both the slip_stitch and chain up in pink round 5 scbp in purple finishing this with an invisible color change to pink 10 scbps in pink pulling through the last scbp using pink even though we are about to do a purple stitch do one purple scbp finishing off with an invisible color change to pink do 10 scbps in pink 22 round 6-8 22 single_crochet around after round 8 slip_stitch into the next stitch and cut and tie off 22 partial round 9 tie a new piece of yarn onto the 9th stitch past the stitch you just tied off in do 1 st3bptog 4 scbps and 1 st3bptog slip_stitch into the next stitch chain 1 then pull on the back loop to tighten the chain body continued round 10 starting in the next stitch past the stitch with the chain do 11 single_crochet skipping the stitch that you tied off round 8 into do 1 increase you will notice that the stitch you did the increase in is larger than most other stitches and has a knot tie into it do 6 scfps around the posts of the partial round above then 1 single_crochet to finish the round 20 round 11-19 20 single_crochet around 20 round 20 1 scbp 2 st3bptog 4 scbp 2 st3bptog 3 scbp 12 stuff round 21 st3tog 3 single_crochet x2 8 tie off and sew opening closed in order to keep the back of the body from puffing up too much from the force of the stuffing we are going to sew along the spine of the back alternative from spine to stomach do this gently only putting enough gauge to barely create an indentation along the spine tail in dark pink make 1 round 1 6 single_crochet in magic_ring 6 round 2-3 6 single_crochet around 6 round 4 inc3 5 single_crochet 8 round 5-6 8 single_crochet around 8 round
